channel.title: Lifehacker
channel.description: Tips and downloads for getting things done
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Paperwhite Tricks, Touchpad Settings, and Flashcards
item.description:
Readers offer their best tips for resetting the time remaining on books or chapters, discovering touchpad features, and flashcard apps.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Walter Glenn

item.title: OldNewExplorer Customizes Windows Explorer to Be More Like Windows 7
item.description:
Windows: Microsoft made some useful improvements to Windows Explorer in Windows 8, but they also (inexplicably) took some things away. OldNewExplorer gives you the best of both worlds: use the Windows 8 features you like, and bring back the Windows 7 features you miss.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Cheating Could Lead to Better Creativity
item.description:
A recent study found that cheating and creativity have a lot in common: in fact, cheating may actually increase your creativity.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Deadspin Anti-Gay Bill Could Cost Arizona The Super Bowl | Gizmodo How Bad Is California's Drought?
item.description:
Deadspin Anti-Gay Bill Could Cost Arizona The Super Bowl | Gizmodo How Bad Is California's Drought? This Bad | io9 A map of music that's popular in your state—and only in your state | Lifehacker Is Having Cable Ever Worth It? | Defamer Here's Justin Bieber Doing Push Ups in Jail | Kinja Popular Posts

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jessica Smith on Jessica, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: Stick to 30 or 60 Second Intervals for Effective Interval Training
item.description:
Interval training is pretty tough work, but it's the best way to keep in shape when you don't have a lot of time on your hands. That said, if you want to do it right, The New York Times suggests you stick with very specific timing.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Most Popular Standing Desk: DIY
item.description:
We've talked about the difference standing instead of sitting all day can make, and how important it is to move around, so it makes sense a standing desk can help. Last week we asked you for the best, then looked at the five best standing desks. Now we're back to highlight the winner of our poll.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: How to Install a Laundry Chute
item.description:
A laundry chute will save you time and energy with fewer trips up and down stairs. The pros at The Family Handyman show you how to find a wall location and install one.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Tessa Miller

item.title: "Write It. Shoot It. Publish It. Crochet It, Sauté It, Whatever, MAKE"
item.description:
Sometimes it's easier to get caught up in the details without bothering to actually complete a project, but filmmaker Joss Whedon's quote reminds us that it doesn't really matter what your creative ideas are—just that you attempt to do them.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Blast Off Into the Future with These Sci-Fi Wallpapers
item.description:
Whether the future holds a technological utopia or a dystopian nightmare, you can enjoy it in the present with these wallpapers.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Make a DIY Rapid-Fire Mouse Button
item.description:
Many computer games ask a lot of your mouse finger. There's only so much rapid-fire clicking you can do on your own. If you find yourself with an aching finger, this DIY rapid-fire mouse button hack might be just the thing.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Walter Glenn

item.title: I'm Jamie Todd Rubin, and This Is How I Work
item.description:
I first connected with Jamie Todd Rubin last year while researching Evernote Ambassadors. (Jamie is Evernote's paperless living ambassador, meaning he's passionate about using Evernote and other programs to live digitally and clutter-free.) Come to find out, he's is also a prolific science fiction writer, blogger, software developer, and dad of two young kids. I caught up with Jamie to find out his tips for writing every day, going paperless, and so much more.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Tessa Miller

item.title: Use a Power Hour to Take Care of Nagging Tasks
item.description:
Taking care of recurring tasks is usually just a matter of building a habit around them. But what about those little one-off tasks that aren't urgent, but still sit there in your to-do list waiting their chance to get done? Try using a "power hour."

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Walter Glenn

item.title: Smart Monitor Shelf, Bluetooth Ear Warmers, Thunderbolt Drive [Deals]
item.description:
If you could use a little more space on your desk (and really, who couldn't?), this monitor shelf comes with a phone dock, a cup holder, and three USB ports to boot. Accouterments aside, it's actually a pretty attractive piece of furniture in its own right.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team

item.title: Rinse Bacon in Water Before Cooking to Reduce Shrinkage by 50 Percent
item.description:
This sounds like a bizarre thing to do, but we're talking about less bacon shrinkage! Rinse your bacon before you cook it and you'll have longer strips to enjoy.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Google Now Launcher Arrives on Google Play Store, Limited Availability
item.description:
Android: When the Nexus 5 first came out, there were whispers that the new launcher would arrive on all devices. While you could sideload it yourself, there wasn't a simple option to download it from Google and get updates. Until now.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Add Lemon to Green Tea for an Even Healthier Drink
item.description:
Green tea is an amazing elixir. You might be able to reap even more health benefits from your cup of tea by adding lemon, according to a few studies.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Is Having Cable Ever Worth It?
item.description:
Dear Lifehacker,
I know you guys aren't big fans of cable, but I'm about to get my internet hooked up and the company is offering me a TV package. I do like to watch plenty of TV and even some sports. Should I at least consider cable? I'm worried Netflix and Hulu won't be enough.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Hooray!
item.description:
Hooray! Google has brought back the option in Google Maps to right-click anywhere for quick directions or the latitude and longitude (in the What's here? option). [Google Maps on Twitter]

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Stick to These Font Sizes to Simplify Designs (and More Design Tips)
item.description:
Whether you're new to graphic or web design or have passed the beginner stage, these tips from David Kadavy can help you simplify your slides, web page, or whatever it is you're making.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: What to Do When You Just Don't Feel Like Working
item.description:
If you've never had a day when you didn't have the energy or motivation to work on that thing you were supposed to be doing, tell us your secret. For the rest of us, Harvard Business Review highlights three common reasons we all procrastinate and their solutions.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Adobe Resets Free Trial for Creative Cloud, Everyone Gets Another Go
item.description:
Adobe is currently sending out emails saying that they're "resetting the clock" on free trials for Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and more for creative cloud members. If you've used a free trial of these products and want another month free, you can do so right now. Read more here.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: The Best Tools to (Productively) Gamify Every Aspect of Your Life
item.description:
The idea of rewarding yourself to build better behaviors isn't new, even if the phrase "gamification" is. There are more tools out there to turn everything you do into a game than are worth trying, but the best of the pack can really help you get motivated. Let's take a look at some of the good ones, and when they can be most effective in your life.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: This Brand New 128GB MicroSD Card is Already $80 Off
item.description:
Earlier this week in Barcelona, SanDisk unveiled the world's first 128GB MicroSD card, and you can already get it at a great price from Amazon.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team

item.title: 3-Minute Journal Helps You Count Your Blessings with Charts
item.description:
Self-tracking may be all the rage, but keeping a log of the things you like and appreciate in life is nothing new. 3-Minute Journal helps you maintain this ancient practice of self-reflection with sweet charts and bar graphs.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: tinyMediaManager Organizes Your Movie Library, Works Across Platforms
item.description:
Windows/OSX/Linux: When we last did a Hive call for best movie library manager, all the options either cost upwards of $30 or were Windows-only. tinyMediaManager solves this problem by being free, cross-platform, and as an added bonus, it's easy to use.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft
